Description: Three re-joined fragments of a carved ivory gaming-piece, circular and domed with a flat base.
Curator's comments: Very probably one of the "three ivory hemispheres, 0.5 to 0.6 inch across (...) from the camp", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72; the two others are Boston, MFA 87.724, 87.725.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 75 § 72) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.81, p.186, pl.28)
